section.p: As you trudge across the pebbles down the water’s edge, a breeze blows in from out at sea, bringing the faintly heard strains of flute music.
‘It’s from the belfry of the old village that now lies out under the sea,’ replies the older man. ‘At low tide you can see the roofs of the buildings. Walk out to them, even.’
‘Not that anyone would,’ puts in the other man with a shudder.
‘They never had a bell, see. A fellow called folk to prayer with his flute. They say he was still playing when the sea closed over his head.’

choices.choice: Return to the top of the cliff
